theme: Laundromat owner runs neighborhood deals between music videos

avatar_style.persona: Sal, 40s. A practical, friendly small business owner. He's proud of his clean, modern laundromat and looks for simple ways to improve customer experience and his bottom line.
avatar_style.wardrobe: Dark gray polo shirt with a small, subtle laundromat logo on the chest. Clean jeans. Looks professional but approachable.
avatar_style.setting: A well-lit, clean laundromat with rows of stainless steel machines. The shot is framed near the folding tables, with a wall-mounted TV visible in the background.

script.speaker: host
script.line: My laundromat's TV used to just be background noise.
script.broll_cue: Wide shot of Sal in his laundromat, TV in the background playing a generic music video.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Now, it quietly makes me an extra $10 to $40 a day, depending on traffic.
script.broll_cue: Quick shot of a phone screen showing a simple earnings graph with small daily payouts.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Folks are here for an hour anyway, so I play music videos. But it felt like a waste.
script.broll_cue: Customer folding laundry, glancing up at the TV.

script.speaker: host
script.line: I found this app, Trillboards. It lets me slide in our own specials and promos from other local spots between songs.
script.broll_cue: On the TV, a music video fades out, and a promo for 'Taco Tuesday' at a local spot fades in.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Setup was nothing. I just opened their website on the TV, scanned a QR code with my phone, and it was paired.
script.broll_cue: Split screen: Sal pointing phone at TV showing screen.trillboards.com QR code; phone screen showing a 'Paired!' confirmation.

script.speaker: host
script.line: I picked a template, and now the coffee shop next door promotes their morning special, and the hardware store shows their weekend sales.
script.broll_cue: Close up of Sal's phone as he scrolls through a marketplace of local promos and taps to add one to his playlist.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It just runs itself. It’s not really 'advertising,' it's more like a useful digital bulletin board for the neighborhood.
script.broll_cue: Final shot of Sal smiling, arms crossed. The TV in the background rotates between a music video and a community event notice.

caption_overlay.text: My laundromat's TV used to just be background noise.
Now, it quietly makes me an extra $10 to $40 a day, depending on traffic.
Folks are here for an hour anyway, so I play music videos. But it felt like a waste.
I found this app, Trillboards. It lets me slide in our own specials and promos from other local spots between songs.
Setup was nothing. I just opened their website on the TV, scanned a QR code with my phone, and it was paired.
I picked a template, and now the coffee shop next door promotes their morning special, and the hardware store shows their weekend sales.
It just runs itself. It’s not really 'advertising,' it's more like a useful digital bulletin board for the neighborhood.

primary: TV screen showing content (music video, promos)
Phone in hand showing the Trillboards app
secondary: Close-up of QR code on TV
Mockup promos for local businesses (coffee, hardware store, yoga)

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Scan QR code from screen.trillboards.com using the phone app.
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: No hardware or complicated setup. Takes less than a minute.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Browse the marketplace for local promos and add to playlist.
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Fills screen time with relevant, paid content without any sales effort.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Set rotation schedule and quiet hours once.
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Runs autonomously without needing to be managed day-to-day.

constraints_and_risks: If you're not the venue owner, you must get permission first.
Earnings are plausible but not guaranteed; they depend on foot traffic, location, and advertiser demand in your area.
Avoid running promos that directly compete with your own business or host venue (e.g., another laundromat's ad).

metrics_hypothesis.shareability_notes: High shareability among other small business owners (cafes, barbershops, waiting rooms, gyms) who have TVs and are looking for low-effort revenue streams.

alt_hooks: This TV pays for my wifi bill and then some. Here's how.
Turning my laundromat's dead screen into a neighborhood bulletin board that pays.

rights_and_clearance_notes: Must use royalty-free or licensed music for any 'music videos' shown on the screen. All business logos/promos shown (e.g., 'Taco Tuesday') must be cleared or use generic, non-branded mockups.
